content.text: I was sent to Becomsbury [?] until Oct. 12 1945. I made many friends in the Army. My duties in the Army was KB I finally the made me a 1st class gunner [unclear] got my Best Friend was John Ferris. And also I met my SGT. Fred Roeck. I enjoyed my stay in Okinawa very much. When I was discharged from Ft. Monmouth New Jersey I was sent home a empty house. My Mother Had a nervous breakdown - Sidney [redacted] - dead at the [?] over felt me their near - All were in NURSING HOME AUSTRALIA Queens. When I arrived there I saw hell. My mother was [?] asked her daughter how she was he told me not too good. They HAD TO GIVE HER SHOCK TREATMENT if - every 2 DAYS - When I saw her again [crossed out text] she seemed better. She stayed there for about 14 days. They sent her home on one off - finally she passed away Sept 16 - 1960 - in a Hospital in HAMPSTEAD L.I.

text_sections.full_transcription:
I was sent to Becomsbury [?] bayonet
36 mo until Oct. 12 1945 - I made many
Friends in the Army -
My duties in THE ARMY was KB
I finally they made me a 1st CLASS
GUNNER making 90.00 MY Best
Friend was John FERRIS - And also I
MET My SGT. FRED Roeck -
I enjoyed my stay in Okinawa very much
When I was discharged from FT. Monmouth
New Jersey I was sent home -
a empty House. My Mother Had a NERVOUS
BREAKDOWN - Sidney SOFIA - dead at the [?]
Own Felt me their near was -
All were in NURSING HOME - ASTORIA Queens -
When I arrived there I saw hell. My mother
was - I then asked her daughter how she was
he Told me not too good - They HAD TO GIVE
HER SHOCK TREATMENT if - every 2 DAYS -
When I saw her again [crossed out: this Probably when]
She seemed better. She Stayed there -
for about 14 days. They sent her Home -
on and off - finally she passed away
Sept 16 - 1960 - in a Hospital in HAMPSTEAD
L.I.

HOUSE_OVERSIGHT_000029

relationships: John Ferris - best friend in Army
insights: Best friend in Army: John Ferris
'enjoyed my stay in Okinawa very much' - Pacific theater
Discharged from Fort Monmouth, New Jersey
Mother had NERVOUS BREAKDOWN while he was at war
'Sidney SOFIA - dead' - unclear family member deceased
Mother in nursing home - Astoria, Queens
'When I arrived there I saw hell' - shocking conditions
Mother receiving SHOCK TREATMENT every 2 days
Mother died September 16, 1960 in Hampstead, Long Island
Seymour's mother (Jeffrey's grandmother) mental health crisis
War trauma compounded by family tragedy
14 days in facility, then in and out of care
forensic_notes: Okinawa service - major WWII battle April-June 1945
'Sidney SOFIA' - unclear if redaction or confusion
